events.name: FCL Lunch Talk: Actively Cooling Singapore using Radiation, the ColdTube Project
events.description:
FCL Lunch Talk: Actively Cooling Singapore using Radiation, the ColdTube Project 
Imagine entering a shaded outdoor space on a normal day in Singapore. The air temperature and humidity around your body is hot - over 30 °C and 75% relative humidity. This outdoor space is not air-conditioned, nor is it ventilated by a fan. Yet, as you stand in this space you begin to feel an unexpected sensation of cooling down. You touch the surfaces around you, and search for a source of cooling, but exposed surfaces feel little different than the hot ambient environment. What becomes even more bewildering is that, after a few minutes in this space, even though the air temperature hasn’t changed, you begin to feel properly cold… outside.. in Singapore… in the middle of the day.
This presentation will introduce “The Cold Tube”, an InterCREATE Seed Project that is exploring new applications of selective materials for radiant cooling in tropical climates. It involves studying the use of infrared-transparent membranes that allow one’s body to “see” actively chilled surfaces hidden behind them, yet are sufficiently separated from these surfaces to avoid condensation. The goal of the project is to demonstrate how this new, energy-efficient technology might provide outdoor thermal comfort in Singapore, without air-conditioning. 
Speaker: Eric Teitelbaum
Eric is a Ph.D. candidate in Princeton University’s School of Architecture Energy and Computation program. His research combines fundamental materials science with thermal comfort in architectural forms, examining new thermodynamic and materials approaches to latent cooling and radiant systems, spanning desiccant dehumidification and M-Cycle evaporative cooling to expanded psychrometric models for thermal comfort. He will begin leading the deployment of the ColdTube outdoor pavilion in July 2018, a project that negotiates the marriage between radiant heat transfer and formal architectural constraints to demonstrate thermal comfort through radiant cooling outdoors in Singapore, 20 °C below the dew point without condensation.
events.location: Value Lab Asia, Singapore-ETH Centre, #06-01, CREATE Tower, 1 Create Way, Singapore 138602

events.name: Made In Singapore: Aerospace Excellence
events.description: Please register at http://sginnovate.com/events/made-singapore-aerospace-excellence. Made In Singapore: Aerospace ExcellencePresented by SGInnovate Lauded as the inaugural “Aerospace City of the Future” by fDi (the intelligence portfolio of The Financial Times), Singapore boasts one of Asia’s largest and most diverse eco-systems with over 130 aerospace players, and is well positioned to build research activities, maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) services, and aircraft manufacturing. Join us as we discuss the clear sky outlook ahead for Singapore’s aviation sector, and the excellent work in talent development, research and manufacturing that is made right here in Singapore. Date: 30 May 2018Time: 5:30pm – 7:30pmVenue: 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme:5:30pm – 6:00pm: Registration6:00pm – 7:00pm: Panel discussion and Q&A7:00pm – 7:30pm: Networking and End Speakers: Dr. Bicky Bhangu, President for Southeast Asia, Pacific and South Korea, Rolls-Royce Dr. Jamie Ng, Senior Scientist and Head of Human Factors and Visual Interface Lab, A*STAR Lim Tau Fuie, Chief Technology Officer, Singapore Technologies Aerospace Nicole Leong, Deputy Head of Business Development, Airbus Moderator: Steve Leonard, Founding CEO, SGInnovate

events.name: iOS Dev Scout May 2018 Meetup
events.description: Join us at this month’s Meetup on the 30th May, hosted by BBM at Level 17, Novena Square Tower B, for an evening of drinks and food, exclusive iOS talks, show & tell! Venue: BBMNovena Square Tower B238B Thomson Road #17-05/08, Singapore[masked] Speakers: • Kenneth Poon• Maciej Piotrowski - iOS Developer @ BBM Agenda: • 6:30pm: Food and refreshments, say hello to other iOS devs• 7:15pm: Hacking via code: Hijacking outgoing network calls - by Kenneth• 7:45pm: Watch your Bluetooth! - by Maciej• 8:15pm: Show & Tell About the Topics: • Hacking via code: Hijacking outgoing network callsKenneth will be giving a talk on writing code to hijack outgoing network calls:- Let's write some code and mess up some production apps- How this technique can benefit you in your automated tests • Watch your Bluetooth!This talk is definitely not about hacking Bluetooth. Core Bluetooth has arrived to Apple Watch. Just watch what your Watch can do! Seats are limited, kindly RSVP at the link below (required for building security clearance).(Venue, food and drinks proudly sponsored by BBM) ----------* Follow us at @iosconfsg for the latest updates! *iOS Conf SG 2017: iOS Conf SG is South East Asia's only annual iOS Conference organised by iOS Dev Scout. Last year's sold-out conference of 300 attendees was held on the 19th and 20th of October with overseas speakers from Facebook, Google, LinkedIn, Instagram, PayPal, PlanGrid, Raywenderlich, Realm, SEA Group, ex-Apple, ex-Twitter and other tech companies to share their technical expertise and experiences. Locally, we’ve speakers from Carousell, Garena, SP Group etc. More information on our next iOS Conf SG will be announced soon. Visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page for the latest updates: iOS Conf SG Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/iOS Conf SG 2017 Videos: https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg-2017iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/ ----------Sponsors:• Special Thanks to BBM for sponsoring the venue, food and drinks! • Special Thanks to Engineers SG (https://twitter.com/engineersftw) for the video recording and coverage!
events.location: BBM, Novena Square Tower B, 238B Thomson Road #17-05/08, Singapore

events.name: Project Sharing Sessions: Universal Labs and XBrick on 30th of May
events.description:
5月30日，BitTemple将为大家带来第一期项目分享会，Universal Labs and XBrick两个区块链创业团队将呈现他们的最新项目。
On 30th of May, BitTemple will bring the first session of Project Sharing Sessions: Universal Labs and XBrick. On the session, Universal Labs and XBrick will show their latest programmes on blockchain field.

活动时间 Time
2018年5月30日（周三）
18:30-20:30
Wednesday, May 30, 20186:30 PM to 8:30 PM

活动地点 Location
新加坡来福士坊9号 共和大厦5层 BitTemple Office
BitTemple Office
9 Raffles Place, 5F Republic Plaza1Singapore 

Universal Labs：
遇见区块链个人云与数字资产所有权的未来
Say Hello to the Future of Blockchain Personal Cloud and Digital Asset Ownership
​
Universal Labs 建立了一个区块链解决方案，用来促进资产所有权数字化以及使数字资产在Ubbey网络和OWP协议的帮助下流通性得以提升。Ubbey网络由Ubbey Box提供技术支持，Universal Labs的区块链个人云设备可作为一个节点存在一该网络中。开发者可以在我们的OWP协议下构建dApps，我们的最终目标是联通物理和虚拟领域间的空隙，并为各种数字资产之间的对等交易搭建一个无摩擦的生态系统。
Universal Labs is building a blockchain solutions designed to facilitate digitalization of asset ownership and making it transferable through the help of Ubbey Network and the Ownership (OWP) protocol. Ubbey Network is powered by Ubbey Box, our blockchain personal cloud device that also act as a node in the network. Developers can build dApps on top of our OWP protocol, our ultimate goal is to bridge the gap between physical and virtual universe and creating a frictionless ecosystem for peer-to-peer transactions of all types of digital assets.


​

Universal Labs的创始人Keda Che是区块链领域的连续创业者。作为哈佛大学软件开发和信息系统硕士以及俄亥俄州立大学数学与经济学学士，他于2015年创立了自己的第一个提供所有权技术的区块链创业团队——Boost VC Tribe 7，而后创立了YQTC——一个提供区块链供应链解决方案的创业团队。YQTC在中国区块链创业企业中位列前16。Keda Che在由哈佛大学、富达投资、花旗银行及纳斯达克联合发起的区块链研究所供职，同时为阿里巴巴、百度、北京华大基因等全球五百强企业提供区块链领域的咨询服务。
Keda Che is a serial entrepreneur in blockchain industry. He founded his first blockchain start-ups Ownership Technology (Boost VC Tribe 7) back in 2015 and went to start YQTC, a supply chain blockchain solution start-ups. YQTC was ranked as the top 16 blockchain start-ups in China recently. He worked at Blockchain Research Lab cosponsored by Harvard University, Fidelity, Citi and NASDAQ. He also provided blockchain consulting services to Fortune 500 companies such as Alibaba, Baidu and Beijing Genomics Institute. Keda has a Master’s degree in software development and information system from Harvard University and Bachelor’s degree in Pure Mathematics and Economics from The Ohio State University. 

Universal Labs的创始人Keda Che将在分享会上展示Universal Labs如何通过改善Ubbey Box个人云专利解决数字资产所有权的问题。这一区块链个人云以节点的形式存在于Ubbey网络之中，使用者可以通过共享储存空间来赚取本地币。
Founder Keda is going to present how Universal Labs is going to solve the digital assets ownership issue by leveraging our proprietary personal cloud product - Ubbey Box. This blockchain personal cloud serve as a node in our Ubbey Network that allows users to share their storage space while earning some of our native token at the same time.

项目详情：http://ulabs.technology/

XBrick

XBrick Exchange— XBrick是一个加密操作的交易系统，目前正在持续升级中，未来将囊括全球综合订单簿。
XBrick is an operating crypto-to-crypto exchange and is in the process of upgrading our trading systems to include the Global Consolidated Order Book.

联合创始机构—Vs Capital Group，位于悉尼，专注于企业财务与澳大利亚股票市场。
Co-founder & COO of XBrick Exchange. Co-founder of Sydney based Vs Capital Group specialise in corporate finance and the equity markets mainly within Australia.

加密货币交换一夜之间在全球兴起，许多问题随之而来。XBrick进行了深入研究，并正在现有的交易平台上，构建一个由顶级运营者构成的新平台。
Crypto exchanges erected from all over the world over night, yet many issues came with it. XBrick understands those issues and is now building on top of its existing trading platform aiming to join those top tier operators and standout above the rest.

项目详情：http://xbrick.io/

主办方及场地支持
​
BitTemple 新加坡，是由火币生态，节点资本，B+ 联合发起，并由科技寺助力落成的区块链孵化器，秉承“BELIEVE IN BLOCKCHAIN”的理念，在新加坡建立世界区块链孵化中心，并配以完善的区块链生态服务体系，为中国，新加坡，世界各地的优质区块链项目提供一站式生态服务。服务包括但不限于：法律合规，项目可行性分析，投融资，媒体公关，交易所上市，社群运营等。

BitTemple，established with the philosophy of “BELIEVE IN BLOCKCHAIN”, is co-founded by Huobi Eco， Node Capital，B+，and powered by TechTemple. We form a World Blockchain Community and build a sound service ecosystem for global qualified blockchain projects，which come from Singapore  the worldwide market. Our one-stop services for BitTemple members  include but are not limited to: Legal Compliance，Project Feasibility Analysis，Financing Services，Media PR，Exchange Listing，Market Value Mangement and Community Operation.
events.location: BitTemple, F5, Republic Plaza, No.9 Raffle Place, Singapore, singapore null

events.name: NightClazz Coding Katas with Xavier Detant, Software Crafter
events.description: The Software Craftsmanship motto is «Raise the bar». In order to do that, you need to learn new things. Leaving your comfort zone is a good way to learn new things, but during this NightClazz, you'll be able to stay where you "think" your comfort zone is. "Think" because, actually, Xavier is going to push you out of your comfort zone from there :) You will code some small coding exercises (45 minutes each) a.k.a.. katas but with strong (and a bit crazy) constraints. We promise, you won't stay within your comfort zone, you will learn a lot and you will have a lot of fun! The only prerequisites is to have a computer and a development environment ready on it. There is absolutely no constraint whatsoever about the language you'll use even if I recommend you to use one you're familiar with (your comfort zone :) ). Xavier Detant is co-organiser of the Software Craftsmanship Community of Paris and the SoCraTes France Unconference. Knowledge sharing is at the heart of his mindset. In love with functional programming and beautiful code, enjoying doing and explaining code made him a passionate crafter. Thanks to Credit Agricole CIB for hosting this event.
events.location: Credit Agricole CIB – Polymorphic Room  , Mapletree Business City II, 80 Pasir Panjang Road #23, Singapore

events.name: Talk.CSS #28
events.description: How long with this spate of efficiency last? We have a location already? Unbelievable. Talk.CSS #28 will be happening on Wednesday, 30 May. We'll be hosted by WeWork Singapore. Now, we just need a couple of speakers... Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur no-longer-new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. How to CSS with confidence by Ken ChuaCSS getting you down? Anxious about refactoring your codebase because you might break a thousand things? Well, we can't guarantee that won't happen BUT Ken has some tips that might help you sleep better at night. Something about CSS architecture by Olivia NgCSS architecture is a topic that will always be relevant, because despite general best practices, how you architect your code will still vary based on the nature of what you're building. So come hear Olivia's take on it this month. The CSS doctor is in (our segment that never gets utilised)Layouts looking a bit broken? CSS issues getting you down? We're here to help. Tell us your CSS problem and get a crowd-sourced solution from all the CSS enthusiasts in Singapore right here. Lightning talks welcome, just poke Chris or Hui Jing when you get there. We welcome any CSS-related topics at ANY level because we’re all here to learn and share :)
events.location: WeWork Beach Centre, Singapore, WeWork Beach Centre, 15 Beach Road
